Articles.Content: What if we could fail the game (or lose serious credits in career mode) by launching a rocket up high, decoupling for example the solid rocket boosters and having them accidentally land on a building of the space center? That would kinda force us to use parachutes or be careful :B
turn 0.01 degree at launch and problem solved
no need to turn at all, planet rotation does it for you

Actually... In career mode once we get it I think we should get penalized for destroying or dropping something large at high speeds on a KSC building... That would mean we would have to be a little bit more careful with construction designs and launches.

I say launched because we would have to angle over into the ocean to be safe about it that way if it were to blow up it would all fall into the ocean... I kinda like this idea.

Firstly, that wouldn't happen unless either A: You had a probe on the SRB, or B: The game kept the SRB persistent when it hit the atmosphere. Secondly, damage to the buildings via impacts are planned.

You had a probe on the SRB
It would get delete even if it had a probe body
damage to ksp buildings and other structures when cities and such come about will cost money. It's in the list of planned features.
Wouldn't the first stages just disappear once they left 2.5km of you?

From the official Planned Features list:

  • Space center facilities can be destroyed by crash-landing onto them, and fixing them will cost money

Yes anything dropped would be deleted after 2.5 km away BUT... What if your rocket exploded just above the pad... Around for example 10 seconds after lift off? A srb could very easily fly off in any given direction and strike the VAB or water tower or any other nearby buildings.
